page.title: 16VISIT TO A GUEST HOUSE
page.content: Windy Harbour Hotel is along Woodhead. It also has caravans and a camping site. It was changed to a hotel from a farm to make a better living. There is space for 60 cars. Mostly businessmen stay there. Young people come to do their Duke of Edinburgh Award scheme. Those using the caravans are mostly tourists. About 240 people stay at the hotel each year. They come from world-wide. There are nine bedrooms, three double and six single and two bathrooms. A party room caters for 120 people. They have two licensed bars and ten casual staff. Visitors stay four days on average. Bed and breakfast is Â£12.50 and an evening meal starts at around Â£6. All the food is home-made and they cater for people on diets e.g. diabetics. The favourite dish is roast beef. People staying there have their main meal at 6.30pm.
